Name: 2-NITRO-9H-FLUORENE
Description: 2-nitrofluorene is a nitroarene that is fluorene substituted by a nitro group at position 2. It has a role as a carcinogenic agent and a mutagen. It is functionally related to a fluorene.

environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) PCCHEM; PCGEMS Graphical Exposure Modeling System USEPA (1987) (2) CLOGP; PCGEMS Graphical Exposure Modeling System USEPA (1986) (3) Lyman WJ et al; Handbook of Chemical Property Estimation Methods NY: McGraw-Hill p. 5-4, 5-10 (1982)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: Based on an estimated water solubility of 1.73 mg/L at 25 °C(1) and an estimated log Kow of 3.97(2), the log BCF of 2-nitro-9H-fluorene has been calculated to range from 2.66 to 2.79 from various regression-derived equations(3,SRC). These log BCF values suggest 2-nitro-9H-fluorene has the potential to bioconcentrate in aquatic systems(SRC).

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Lutin PA et al; Purdue Univ Eng Bull Ext Series 118: 131-45 (1965) (2) Malaney GW et al; J Water Pollut Control Fed 39: 2020-9 (1967)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: Levels of oxygen uptake for 500 mg/l of 2-nitro-9H-fluorene oxidized in activated sewage sludge suspensions with suspended solid concn of 2,500 ng/l did not differ from the controls(1,2). After 144 hours, oxygen consumptions were about 1800, 1700 and 300 mg/L for Franklin, Nashville and Ashland sludge, respectively(1), whereas, corresponding controls accounted for losses of approximately 1650, 1500 and 450 mg of oxygen per liter(1).

mechanism_of_action.References: Clayton, G. D. and F. E. Clayton (eds.). Patty's Industrial Hygiene and Toxicology: Volume 2A, 2B, 2C: Toxicology. 3rd ed. New York: John Wiley Sons, 1981-1982., p. 2420
mechanism_of_action.Value: THE REDN OF AROMATIC NITRO CMPD TO THEIR CORRESPONDING HYDROXYLAMINO DERIVATIVES MAY ... EXPLAIN THE CARCINOGENIC ACTION OF SUCH AGENTS AS 2-NITROFLUORINE ...

sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: Sediment from the Suimon River, Japan contained 2-nitro-9H-fluorene at an average concn of 1.5 ppb(1).

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) PCCHEM; PCGEMS Graphical Exposure Modeling System USEPA (1987) (2) CLOGP; PCGEMS Graphical Exposure Modeling System USEPA (1986) (3) Lyman WJ et al; Handbook of Chemical Property Estimation Methods NY: McGraw-Hill p. 4-9 (1982) (4) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 16-28 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Based on an estimated water solubility of 1.73 mg/L at 25 °C(1) and an estimated log Kow of 3.97(2), the Koc of 2-nitro-9H-fluorene has been calculated to range from 3200 to 3450 from various regression-derived equations(4,SRC). These Koc values indicate 2-nitro-9H-fluorene will be slightly mobile in soil(4).
